author: Special Correspondent
text:
Rani Venkatesan, former member and State Executive member of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee, Jerome Arockiaraj, prsident, Tiruchi Urban District unit, and N. Jayaprakash, president, Tiruchi North unit, interviewing a candidate seeking the party ticket in Tiruchi on Wednesday.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

The Congress, which has made an electoral understanding with the DMK, on Wednesday interviewed the candidates aspiring for a party ticket to contest the forthcoming Assembly elections in the State.

The interview for the candidates, who have sought ticket for nine Assembly constituencies in Tiruchi district, was held at Arunachala Mandram here.

Rani Venkatesan, former MLA and State Executive Committee member, interviewed the candidates. Jerome Arockiaraj, president, Tiruchi urban district, and N. Jayaprakash, president (Tiruchi North), were officiating members of the panel.

However, R.C. Babu, president (Tiruchi South), who is the supporter of Chidambaram faction and one of the officiating panel members, did not participate in the interview. Of the 98 candidates, who have sought the party ticket, 90, including 13 women, attended the interview.

Mr. Arockiaraj, who has sought ticket for Tiruchi East constituency, was also interviewed by the panel.

However, some prominent persons who have applied for various constituencies, including A. Joseph Louis, R.C. Babu, and Suba. Somu did not attend the interview.
title: Congress panel interviews ticket-seekers in Tiruchi
